result.execSummary:
The defendant Samara Simone Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA SAMPLE and pay DNA SURCHARGE.
Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges by 11/07/2022.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Credit of 5 days time served. THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samara Simone Miller

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samara Simone Miller in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  William R. F Ackell appeared on behalf of Stephan Eduard Nolten for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
As to COUNT 1: 
Defendant ordered to serve 5 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 5 DAYS time served. THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA SAMPLE and pay DNA SURCHARGE, 

Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges by 11/07/2022.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Court advised Defendant of his her right to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Samara Simone Miller in court with attorney Jade K Hall. William R. F. Ackell appeared on behald of Stephan Eduard Noltenfor the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to AMENDED COUNT 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

Defendant Samara Simone Miller in court with Attorney Jade K Hall; both appear by video.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

Defendant Samara Simone Miller in court by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 45.
Defendant Samara Simone Miller in court.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for indigency hearing.  Discussion held.  Court passed case to allow the defendant to contact the Public Defender's Office regarding possible eligibility.  
...
Case recalled.  Same appearances. 
Defendant now qualifies for Public Defender representation and the Public Defender's Office will appoint counsel.  Court set a preliminary hearing date.  Case adjourned to Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Indigency hearing on April 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
ALL CONDITIONS OF BAIL REMAIN AS PREVIOUSLY SET

Defendant Samara Simone Miller in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for status at 8:30am. Defendant appears at 1:30pm.   Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for an indigency hearing in Br. 40 for Br. 45.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 300.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Samara Simone Miller not in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for status. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Defendant Samara Simone Miller not in court.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court.   Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a Preliminary Hearing. Defense Counsel advised the Court that she does not have paperwork for the defendant and requests an adjournment. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Samara Simone Miller
Current: 3221 North Palmer Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212   (Effective: 03-03-2022)
Prior: 3261 North 34th Street #Front, Milwaukee, WI 53216

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Samara Simone Miller in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/3/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/3/22 @ 1p
